answers.answer: Yep. This is my second pregnancy. I had gd with my first and now again.  It's rough and yes the sweets and quick fix stuff is extra tempting but continue on your diet even if it bites.  I eventually got used to it. Make sure other people know what you can and cannot have that way they won't offer it to you. I have about 8 weeks left.  Hang in there Mama. You can do it....... :-) best of luck.
I was diagnosed with it at about 12 weeks. I've been really good. But it's so long before I  can eat anything I'm craving! Argh! Only 20 more weeks to go.
Im almost 20 weeks. Found out earlyAt 17 weeks started insulin. I will do anything for a healthy baby. I crave sweets. Don't give up going to events. Ask your doctor if a small sweet would be okay.

Me too, its hard but its almost over just stick it out. I told myself as soon as I get the O.K. im going to have a binge day lol cookies and ice cream yay! So focus on a special treat for after your baby is born
Try Russell Stover Sugar Free candies...there really good!

Oh hun. I cried heaps over this. It's my second pregnancy with gd. On the bright side it WILL be over when the baby is out and that first piece of choc cake tastes heavenly!What i did this time is get me some low sugar or sugar free treats that help me cope with the cravings. Do some research on which sweeteners are safe and then look for products containing those. Or you can bake something yourself.I allow myself one sachet coffee per day. They have a tiny amount of sugar and make me feel real good.With my gd, I can't take any carbs, even the healthy ones so i was on oral meds in first pregnancy and now i chose insulin injections.  Are you managing your gd with diet alone? Please don't skip carbs. It may be a good idea to do a food diary a week before your next appointment so you get the best treatment for your needs.xoxo
Just a thought, when you get invited out,  let your host know you are diabetic or bring your own stash. All my friends are more than happy to have healthy alternatives for me :)

I was diagnosed early on as well, due to family history. I cried and had a tough time at first, but it has gotten very manageable now. Try subbing something healthy and sweet for the junkfood cravings. Have some fruit or even a peice of sugarfree gum. And be honest with your dietician. Mine has been amazing and so supportive! And make sure to keep an eye on bg levels after baby. Gd can turn into type 2 for up to 50 percent of women!

And also i was diagnosed at 27 weeks with my first but because of high risk they tested me early this time. I've been on the diet since i turned 18 weeks. Now THAT is a long time. But on the positive note, I have actually grown accustomed to it.

You have to be careful after baby comes too. Gd increases the chance of getting regular diabetes later in life. Sugar and simple carbs aren't necessary for the body. It's all excess. We only developed a high carb diet via agriculture after we ate our preferred foods to near extinction. I do miss sweets so I use splenda and xylitol and nut flours. They aren't real flours from grain but finely ground nuts.

question: I found out a couple weeks ago that I have Gestational Diabetes.  I'm having a pretty difficult time with this. I'm sticking to the diet for the most part but all I want are sweats. My biggest motivation is having a healthy baby. That's what is getting me through it. But I broke down last night and started sobbing. I don't even want to eat anymore.  And of course now that I can't eat the food I want to, I'm getting invited to things that have to deal with the kinds of food I'm not allowed to have. So I just make up reasons that I can't go.  Only 7 1/2 weeks to go though.Anyone else going throug this as well?
title: gestational diabetes
